data.title: Amy Winehouse Foundation on LinkedIn: #resilience #prevention #education #mentalhealth
data.meta_description: Always a thrill for our #Resilience Programme team to work with the young people at The BRIT School,   where Amy was a former student. This week, as part ofâ€¦
data.text:
The Trip: A Glimpse into Transformation ğŸ˜ Before the trip, there was Glee, a bundle of nerves, tears streaming down her face, reluctant to leave the cocoon of her parents' embrace. But after just one night and two days, Glee returned with a spark in her eyes, brimming with stories of courage and camaraderie. She extended a heartfelt thank you to her teacher, grateful for an experience that nudged her to face her fears and step beyond the comfort of a home where doting parents and attentive servants were always at her beck and call. In this brief journey, Glee found a friend in Mia, a girl often misunderstood for her aggression. Yet, in this shared adventure, Mia emerged as a pillar of strength for Glee, showcasing empathy and care she didnâ€™t display or perhaps went unseen in the corridors of school. This excursion might well be the turning point for Glee, a significant stride towards blossoming into a confident young girl, less dependent on constant adult approval and assistance. And Mia? She returned to a world that now looks at her with renewed respect and understanding, both from peers and teachers. Her actions have rewritten the narrative that once defined her. This is the essence of education. It's about these profound yet subtle moments that leave indelible marks on children's lives. Itâ€™s a reminder for us, the adults, to set aside our preconceived labels and approach each child with an open mind and heart. Such experiences reaffirm the transformative power of schooling â€“ it's not just in the lessons we teach, but in the life-changing journeys we facilitate. #Education #Transformation #Growth #StudentExperience #LifeLessons

Did you know only 9% of Americans keep their New Years Resolutions? A whopping 23% quit by the end of the first week in January and 43% quit by the end of the month (according to Fisher College of Business). What makes a resolution so hard to commit ğŸ’ªğŸ¼ to? Do we over think ğŸ§  it? Are our expectations too high ğŸ˜±? Do we make resolutions about things that do not necessarily matter ğŸ¤·â™€ï¸? If we fall off the path, is it too hard to get back on? If you think about it resolutions are the perfect way to talk about goal â° setting, establish simple steps for achieving a goal (it doesn't have to be huge!), and an overall commitment to whatever your resolution is about whether it be towards healthğŸŒ¡, homeğŸ  or happinessğŸ¤©! Goal setting is a life skill as we work collaboratively to build active minds ğŸ’­, healthy bodies ğŸ, and happy hearts â¤ï¸. Check out this week's blog on how to make the usually daunting task of goal setting fun, engaging, and one in which the whole family can participate in! #primroseproud #newyears #resolutions #newyears2024 #family #preschool #toddler #goals #primroseproud #primrosehudl #primroselincoln #leadershipmatters #leadership

This week I've made some exciting progress cold calling schools to introduce the Murals in Schools project. It's been a significant breakthrough for me as I transition from the world of thoughts and judgments to the world of performance and action. Distinguishing between the worlds of performance and morality has been eye-opening. In the world of performance, it's all about the facts - what I did or didn't do. On the other hand, the world of morality revolves around identity and value judgments - whether something is good or bad. Separating performance from morality is empowering. Instead of getting caught up in emotions and self-criticism, I'm focusing on taking more action and moving forward. If a school isn't interested, I call another one! #MuralsinSchools #ColdCalling #landmarkforum

Leaping into a new school year as a very #proud #elementaryschoolprincipal. I have officially named this â€œthe year of #connection and #kindness.â€ Connection to our #students, our #families, our #community, each other, and ourselves. Connection doesnâ€™t happen by accident. Itâ€™s something we need to create. Just because weâ€™re wired for it doesnâ€™t mean weâ€™re competent at it. We need to teach it and we need to live it. Kindness, genuine kindness. Not that confetti kindness. The kindness that is proactive to niceâ€™s reactive. The kindness that takes #hardwork, #energy, and #thoughtfulness. The type of kindness that leaves somebody better than the way we found them. Throughout the last week of Staff #In-Service, I made sure my #teachers and #staff heard me tell them â€œI Need You.â€, â€œYou are here for a reason.â€, and, â€œYou make a difference even larger than you may ever know.â€ All of which couldnâ€™t be more true, and all of which, I know Iâ€™ll never be able to tell them enough this school year. I #challenge everyone here to think about what you are doing to #lead with #kindness and #connection. Please leave a note on this post to share a little bit about your work around this. Now, letâ€™s all begin to create our To Be Lists in addition to those daily To Do Lists. Wishing everyone a #schoolyear filled with #joy, #growth, and #purpose. ğŸ’™

â€œThought of the Dayâ€!!!! â€œMake Something Happenâ€!!!! When I was blessed with the opportunity to work with parents of elementary and middle school children, I needed a way to introduce myself in a warm and welcoming way. So what did I do???? I dug in the crates LOL ğŸ˜‚!!!! I pulled out my old reliable gift basket making trinkets and created a fun icebreaker. Yep, the parents loved it and I found a way to start a conversation about how Iâ€™m here to help not intrude. So when you are faced with a new endeavor full of unknowns, turn to your creative side and â€œMAKE SOMETHING HAPPEN â€œ!!!!!!!#workforcetraining
